'''''Minecraft: Tricky Trials (Original Game Soundtrack)''''', also known as '''''Minecraft: 1.21 Soundtrack''''' on some platforms, is the fourth soundtrack for ''[[Minecraft]]'' featuring [[Lena Raine]], as well as the second featuring [[Aaron Cherof]] and [[Kumi Tanioka]].<ref name="compose-mcnet">{{mcnet|composing-trial-chambers|Composing the Trial Chambers|April 27, 2024|Sophie Austin}}</ref> It has been released on various music platforms since April 26, 2024.

The album includes 12 songs for a total length of nearly an hour. It serves as the soundtrack for the Tricky Trials update and includes three new music disc tracks.<ref>{{ytl|ONs7kTlqGw4|THE 1.21 UPDATE OFFICIAL NAME IS... &vert; MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|April 26, 2024}}</ref>

== Trivia ==
* The word ''komorebi'' (<span lang="ja"><ruby>木漏<rp>[</rp><rt>こも</rt><rp>]</rp></ruby>れ<ruby>日<rp>[</rp><rt>び</rt><rp>]</rp></ruby></span>) means "sunlight filtering through trees" in Japanese.
* The word ''pokopoko'' (<span lang="ja">ポコポコ</span>) is an onomatopoeia in Japanese, which simulates the sound of bubbles popping or a hollow object being knocked.
** According to the artist, in this track she "wanted to express a bird's-eye view of the world of Minecraft while delving a little more freely into it".<ref name="compose-mcnet" />
* The word ''yakusoku'' (<span lang="ja"><ruby>約束<rp>, </rp><rt>やくそく</rt></ruby></span>) means "promise" in Japanese.
* ''Eld'' is an archaic English word, meaning "old".
* Some tracks in this album feature melodies similar to previous soundtracks:
** Part of melodies in ''Watcher'' resemble ''[[Bromeliad]]'' and ''[[Echo in the Wind]]''.
** Part of melodies in ''komorebi'' resemble ''[[Comforting Memories]]''.
** Part of melodies in ''Deeper'' and ''Endless'' resemble ''[[Infinite Amethyst]]''.
** Part of melodies in Puzzlebox resemble [[Aria Math]].
** Melodies near the end of ''Precipice'' resemble ''[[Moog City]]'' or ''[[Moog City 2]]''.
